meanings.definition: A group of disorders characterized by abnormalities in the structure or production of hemoglobin.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that hemoglobinopathies are conditions that affect the way hemoglobin is made in the body.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying different hemoglobinopathies to understand how they impact the blood.
meanings.sent3: Even though it sounds like a mouthful, hemoglobinopathies are just variations in how our blood works.
meanings.sent4: In the world of blood disorders, hemoglobinopathies stand out as complex puzzles to solve.
meanings.sent5: Learning about hemoglobinopathies can help us appreciate the intricacies of our own bodies.

meanings.definition: Conditions caused by genetic mutations affecting hemoglobin production.
meanings.sent1: Genetic counselors can provide information on the inheritance patterns of hemoglobinopathies.
meanings.sent2: Hemoglobinopathies can lead to different types of anemia due to the genetic changes.
meanings.sent3: Some people find it fascinating how hemoglobinopathies are linked to our DNA.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of genetics, hemoglobinopathies are like spelling errors in the book of life.
meanings.sent5: Understanding hemoglobinopathies requires diving into the world of genetic variations.
